topic.title: SHI Block Retimer Mode Connectivity Rules

body.p: The device supports a SERDES retimer mode as noted in the section Overview where the SERDES receivers on bank A are 1:1 connected to the SERDES transmitters on bank B and vice-versa. The retimer mode SERDES connectivity rules are as follows.

li.p: Rule: retimer mode supports 1:1 connection of SERDES from bank A to SERDES on bank B and vice versa. Retimer mode is not supported between any other bank combinations.

Rule: PAM4 and NRZ rules apply when connecting SERDES between bank A and bank B in retimer mode. Groups of 4 SERDES in NRZ mode can be connected between bank A and bank B on SHI block boundaries. Groups of 2 SERDES in PAM4 mode can be connected between bank A and bank B on SHI subgroup boundaries.
Rule: a mix of SERDES in retimer mode and other SERDES on bank A or bank B that are not in retimer mode and are connected to Interlaken, Ethernet, line OTN, or system OTN subsystems is supported.

body.p: Examples of the above rules are as follows.

li.p: SA_RXI/TXO_P/N[11:0] <> SB_TXO/RXI_P/N[11:0] are connected 1:1 in NRZ retimer mode, SB_RXI/TXO_P/N[23:12] are connected as 12 x 56.25 Gbps Interlaken.
SA_RXI/TXO_P/N[11:4] <> SB_RXI/TXO_P/N[11:4] PAM-4 are connected 1:1 in PAM-4 retimer mode, SA_RXI_TXO_P/N[3:0] NRZ are CAUI-4 connected to the Ethernet subsystem.
